newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-HOLDERS PSG CRUISE THROUGH 7-0 ON AGGREGATE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HOLDERS PSG CRUISE THROUGH 7-0 ON AGGREGATE.

text.p: Holders Paris Saint-Germain, resting several first-choice players including key Brazilian Leonardo, cruised to a 3-0 home win over Vaduz in their European Cup Winners' Cup first round second leg match on Thursday.
The Liechtenstein part-timers at least achieved their objective which had been to not lose by more than 4-0, the score in the first leg two weeks ago.
Reserve forward Bernard Allou, who scored the fourth goal in Liechtenstein, opened the tally at the Parc des Princes in the 22nd minute from a cross by midfielder Jerome Leroy.
French international defender Alain Roche headed the second five minutes before the interval from a centre by midfielder Vincent Guerin.
Cameroon striker Patrick Mboma added the third three minutes into the second half.
French first division leaders PSG have yet to concede a goal in 10 matches this season, keeping eight clean sheets in the league and two in the Cup Winners' Cup.
